summary.span: 定义可以跨多个版本的组件、类型或类型成员的兼容性保证。

span.span: Defines the compatibility guarantee of a component, type, or type member that may span multiple versions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的组件和类库开发人员用于指示其库的使用者可以预期跨多个版本的兼容性级别。The is used by developers of components and class libraries to indicate the level of compatibility that consumers of their libraries can expect across multiple versions. 它指示库或组件的未来版本将不会中断现有客户端的保证的级别。It indicates the level of guarantee that a future version of the library or component will not break an existing client. 然后，客户端可以使用作为设计自己的界面以确保在版本之间的稳定性的辅助手段。Clients can then use the as an aid in designing their own interfaces to ensure stability across versions. > [!NOTE] > 公共语言运行时 (CLR) 不以任何方式使用此属性。The common language runtime (CLR) does not use this attribute in any way. 正式记录组件作者的意图在于它的值。Its value lies in formally documenting the intent of the component author. 编译时工具还可使用这些声明来检测编译时错误，否则会违反已声明的保证。Compile-time tools can also use these declarations to detect compile-time errors that would otherwise break the declared guarantee. ## 兼容性级别Levels of Compatibility 支持以下兼容性级别的成员表示枚举：The supports the following levels of compatibility, which are represented by members of the enumeration: - 任何版本的兼容性 ()。No version-to-version compatibility (). 客户端可以预期将来的版本会中断现有客户端。The client can expect that future versions will break the existing client. 有关详细信息，请参阅[无兼容性](#None)本主题后面的部分。For more information, see the [No Compatibility](#None) section later in this topic. - 通过并行版本的兼容性 ()。Side-by-side version-to-version compatibility (). 组件已经过测试，若要运行的程序集的多个版本加载同一个应用程序域中时。The component has been tested to work when more than one version of the assembly is loaded in the same application domain. 一般情况下，未来版本可能会破坏兼容性。In general, future versions can break compatibility. 但是，当进行重大更改时，旧版本将不会修改，但存在与新版本。However, when breaking changes are made, the old version is not modified but exists alongside the new version. 通过并行执行是预期的方式，使工作进行重大更改时的现有客户端。Side-by-side execution is the expected way to make existing clients work when breaking changes are made. 有关详细信息，请参阅[-并行兼容性](#SideBySide)本主题后面的部分。For more information, see the [Side-by-Side Compatibility](#SideBySide) section later in this topic. - 稳定的版本的兼容性 ()。Stable version-to-version compatibility (). 未来版本应该不会中断客户端，并通过并行执行应不必需的。Future versions should not break the client, and side-by-side execution should not be needed. 但是，如果客户端意外中断，它可能无法使用通过并行执行来解决此问题。However, if the client is inadvertently broken, it may be possible to use side-by-side execution to fix the problem. 有关详细信息，请参阅[稳定兼容性](#Standard)部分。For more information, see the [Stable Compatibility](#Standard) section. - Exchange 版本的兼容性 ()。Exchange version-to-version compatibility (). 特别小心以确保将来的版本不会中断客户端。Extraordinary care is taken to ensure that future versions will not break the client. 客户端应仅使用这些类型用于与其他程序集部署互相独立地进行通信的接口的签名中。The client should use only these types in the signature of interfaces that are used for communication with other assemblies that are deployed independently of one another. 预期只有一个版本的这些类型可在给定的应用程序域中，这意味着如果客户端，通过并行执行无法修复兼容性问题。Only one version of these types is expected to be in a given application domain, which means that if a client breaks, side-by-side execution cannot fix the compatibility problem. 有关详细信息，请参阅[交换类型兼容性](#Exchange)部分。For more information, see the [Exchange Type Compatibility](#Exchange) section. 以下各节讨论每个级别的更详细地保证。The following sections discuss each level of guarantee in greater detail. ### 不兼容性No Compatibility 将组件作为标记指示提供程序兼容性提供任何保证。Marking a component as indicates that the provider makes no guarantees about compatibility. 客户端应避免在公开的接口上有任何依赖项。Clients should avoid taking any dependencies on the exposed interfaces. 此级别的兼容性可用于实验性或，公开的但仅供始终在同一时间更新的组件类型。This level of compatibility is useful for types that are experimental or that are publicly exposed but are intended only for components that are always updated at the same time. 显式指示此组件不应使用由外部组件。 explicitly indicates that this component should not be used by external components. ### 通过并行兼容性Side-by-Side Compatibility 将组件作为标记指示组件已经过测试工作的程序集的多个版本加载到同一应用程序域中时。Marking a component as indicates that the component has been tested to work when more than one version of the assembly is loaded into the same application domain. 允许进行重大更改，只要对具有更高版本的版本号的程序集。Breaking changes are allowed as long as they are made to the assembly that has the greater version number. 应绑定到程序集的旧版本的组件继续绑定到的旧版本和其他组件可以将绑定到新版本。Components that are bound to an old version of the assembly are expected to continue to bind to the old version, and other components can bind to the new version. 还有可能要更新一个组件，它被声明为通过破坏性的方式修改旧版本。It is also possible to update a component that is declared to be by destructively modifying the old version. ### 稳定的兼容性Stable Compatibility 标记类型为指示该类型，应在版本之间保持稳定。Marking a type as indicates that the type should remain stable across versions. 但是，它也可能会通过并行版本的稳定类型相同的应用程序域中存在。However, it may also be possible for side-by-side versions of a stable type to exist in the same application domain. 稳定类型维护一个高二进制文件兼容性栏。Stable types maintain a high binary compatibility bar. 因此，提供程序应避免对稳定类型进行重大更改。Because of this, providers should avoid making breaking changes to stable types. 以下类型的更改是可接受：The following kinds of changes are acceptable: - 私有实例字段中添加或删除字段，一个类型，前提这不会中断的序列化格式。Adding private instance fields to, or removing fields from, a type, as long as this does not break the serialization format. - 更改为可序列化类型的非可序列化类型。Changing a non-serializable type to a serializable type. （但是，可序列化类型不能更改为非可序列化类型。）(However, a serializable type cannot be changed to a non-serializable type.) - 引发新的、 更派生的异常从方法。Throwing new, more derived exceptions from a method. - 改善性能的一种方法。Improving the performance of a method. - 只要更改不产生不利影响的客户端的大多数更改返回值的范围。Changing the range of return values, as long as the change does not adversely affect the majority of clients. - 如果业务理由很充分，并且受产生负面影响的客户端数较低，则修复严重的 bug。Fixing serious bugs, if the business justification is high and the number of adversely affected clients is low. 由于新版本的稳定组件不会中断现有客户端，通常只有一个版本的稳定组件需要在应用程序域中。Because new versions of stable components are not expected to break existing clients, generally only one version of a stable component is needed in an application domain. 但是，这不是必需的因为稳定的类型不用作达成一致的所有组件的 exchange 的已知类型。However, this is not a requirement, because stable types are not used as well-known exchange types that all components agree upon. 因此，如果固定的组件的新版本会无意中破坏某些组件，并且其他组件都需要新版本，它可能可以通过加载旧的和新组件同时解决此问题。Therefore, if a new version of a stable component does inadvertently break some component, and if other components need the new version, it may be possible to fix the problem by loading both the old and new component. 提供了更强的版本兼容性保证比。 provides a stronger version compatibility guarantee than . 它是公共的默认值的多版本组件。It is a common default for multi-version components. 可以结合，组件将不会破坏兼容性，但测试可运行多个版本加载到给定的应用程序域中时所处的状态。 can be combined with , which states that the component will not break compatibility but is tested to work when more than one version is loaded in a given application domain. 类型或方法被标记为后，它可以升级到。After a type or method is marked as , it can be upgraded to . 但是，它无法降级到。However, it cannot be downgraded to . ### 交换类型兼容性Exchange Type Compatibility 标记类型为提供了更强的版本兼容性保证比，并且应应用于所有类型的最稳定。Marking a type as provides a stronger version compatibility guarantee than , and should be applied to the most stable of all types. 这些类型旨在用于跨同时时间 （任何版本的 CLR） 或任何版本的组件或应用程序中的所有组件边界独立构建的组件和空间 （跨进程，在一个进程中的跨 CLR 之间的交换跨应用程序域一个 CLR 中）。These types are intended to be used for interchange between independently built components across all component boundaries in both time (any version of the CLR or any version of a component or application) and space (cross-process, cross-CLR in one process, cross-application domain in one CLR). 如果对交换类型进行重大更改，就无法通过类型的多个版本加载解决此问题。If a breaking change is made to an exchange type, it is impossible to fix the issue by loading multiple versions of the type. 仅当一个问题是非常严重 （如严重安全问题） 或破坏的可能性会很低 （即，如果代码可能不会采取依赖项上以随机方式破坏行为） 时，才应更改交换类型。Exchange types should be changed only when a problem is very serious (such as a severe security issue) or the probability of breakage is very low (that is, if the behavior was already broken in a random way that code could not have conceivably taken a dependency on). 对交换类型，可以进行以下类型的更改：You can make the following kinds of changes to an exchange type: - 添加继承的新接口定义。Add inheritance of new interface definitions. - 添加新的私有方法实现的新继承的接口定义的方法。Add new private methods that implement the methods of newly inherited interface definitions. - 添加新的静态字段。Add new static fields. - 添加新的静态方法。Add new static methods. - 添加新的非虚拟实例方法。Add new non-virtual instance methods. 以下被视为中断性更改，不允许使用基元类型：The following are considered breaking changes and are not allowed for primitive types: - 更改序列化格式。Changing serialization formats. 版本容错序列化是必需的。Version-tolerant serialization is required. - 添加或删除私有实例字段。Adding or removing private instance fields. 此风险更改类型的序列化格式和破坏使用反射的客户端代码。This risks changing the serialization format of the type and breaking client code that uses reflection. - 更改类型的可序列化性。Changing the serializability of a type. 非可序列化类型不能设置为可序列化，反之亦然。A non-serializable type may not be made serializable, and vice versa. - 引发方法的不同异常。Throwing different exceptions from a method. - 更改方法的返回值的范围，除非成员定义引发这种可能性，并清楚地表明客户端应如何处理未知的值。Changing the range of a method's return values, unless the member definition raises this possibility and clearly indicates how clients should handle unknown values. - 修复 bug 最多。Fixing most bugs. 类型的使用者将依赖于现有行为。Consumers of the type will rely on the existing behavior. 后一个组件，类型或成员标记有保证，则无法更改为任一或。After a component, type, or member is marked with the guarantee, it cannot be changed to either or . 通常情况下，exchange 类型都是基本类型 (如并.NET Framework 中) 和接口 (如， ，和)，通常用在公共接口。Typically, exchange types are the basic types (such as and in the .NET Framework) and interfaces (such as , , and ) that are commonly used in public interfaces. 交换类型上公开也会使用标记的其他类型兼容性。Exchange types may publicly expose only other types that are also marked with compatibility. 此外，交换类型不能依赖于可能有更改的 Windows Api 的行为。In addition, exchange types cannot depend on the behavior of Windows APIs that are prone to change. ## 组件保证：摘要Component Guarantees: A Summary 下表指示组件的特征和使用情况如何影响其兼容性保证。The following table indicates how a component's characteristics and usage affect its compatibility guarantee. |组件特征Component characteristics|ExchangeExchange|稳定版Stable|通过并行Side-by-Side|NoneNone| |-------------------------------|--------------|------------|--------------------|----------| |可以在组件之间的接口中该版本单独使用。Can be used in interfaces between components that version independently.|YY|NN|NN|NN| |可以是 （专用） 的程序集版本的单独使用。Can be used (privately) by an assembly that versions independently.|YY|YY|YY|NN| |可以在单个应用程序域中具有多个版本。Can have multiple versions in a single application domain.|NN|YY|YY|YY| |可以进行重大更改Can make breaking changes|NN|NN|YY|YY| |经测试以确保可以一起加载的程序集的多个版本。Tested to make certain multiple versions of the assembly can be loaded together.|NN|NN|YY|NN| |可以在位置进行重大更改。Can make breaking changes in place.|NN|NN|NN|YY| |可进行非常安全的非换行服务中发生的更改。Can make very safe non-breaking servicing changes in place.|YY|YY|YY|YY| ## 应用特性Applying the Attribute 您可以将应用到程序集、 类型或类型成员。You can apply the to an assembly, a type, or a type member. 它的应用程序是分层的。Its application is hierarchical. 也就是说，默认情况下，可保证由定义属性在程序集级别属性的程序集和这些类型中的所有成员中定义的所有类型的保证。That is, by default, the guarantee defined by the property of the attribute at the assembly level defines the guarantee of all types in the assembly and all members in those types. 同样，如果保证应用于类型，默认情况下它也适用于类型的每个成员。Similarly, if the guarantee is applied to the type, by default it also applies to each member of the type. 可通过应用重写此继承的保证到各个类型和类型成员。This inherited guarantee can be overridden by applying the to individual types and type members. 但是，重写默认的保证仅可以降低保证;它们不能增强它。However, guarantees that override the default can only weaken the guarantee; they cannot strengthen it. 例如，如果程序集将标有保证，其类型和成员具有不兼容性保证，以及应用于类型或成员的程序集中的任何其他保证会被忽略。For example, if an assembly is marked with the guarantee, its types and members have no compatibility guarantee, and any other guarantee that is applied to types or members in the assembly is ignored. ## 测试，可保证Testing the Guarantee 属性返回的成员枚举，它将标有属性。The property returns a member of the enumeration, which is marked with the attribute. 这意味着，你应测试感兴趣的屏蔽掉可能未知的标志的标志。This means that you should test for the flag that you are interested in by masking away potentially unknown flags. 例如，下面的示例测试是否类型标记为。For example, the following example tests whether a type is marked as . [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Versioning.ComponentGuaranteesAttribute.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.componentguaranteesattribute.class/cs/apply1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.Versioning.ComponentGuaranteesAttribute.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.componentguaranteesattribute.class/vb/apply1.vb#1)] 下面的示例测试是否类型标记为或。The following example tests whether a type is marked as or . [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Versioning.ComponentGuaranteesAttribute.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.componentguaranteesattribute.class/cs/apply1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.Versioning.ComponentGuaranteesAttribute.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.componentguaranteesattribute.class/vb/apply1.vb#2)] 以下示例测试可以是一种类型被标记为(即，既不也不)。The following example tests wither a type is marked as (that is, neither nor ). [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Versioning.ComponentGuaranteesAttribute.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.componentguaranteesattribute.class/cs/apply1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.Versioning.ComponentGuaranteesAttribute.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.runtime.versioning.componentguaranteesattribute.class/vb/apply1.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Runtime.Versioning.ComponentGuaranteesOptions guarantees) cil managed

param.name: guarantees
param.span: 用于指定保证的跨多个版本的兼容性级别的枚举值之一。

span.span: One of the enumeration values that specifies the level of compatibility that is guaranteed across multiple versions.

summary.span: 使用一个指示某个库、类型或成员保证的跨多个版本的兼容性级别的值初始化 类的新实例。

span.span: Initializes a new instance of the class with a value that indicates a library, type, or member's guaranteed level of compatibility across multiple versions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当实例化类时，值`guarantees`参数分配给属性。When the class is instantiated, the value of the `guarantees` parameter is assigned to the property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Guarantees As ComponentGuaranteesOptions

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示保证的跨多个版本的库、类型或类型成员的兼容性级别。

span.span: Gets a value that indicates the guaranteed level of compatibility of a library, type, or type member that spans multiple versions.

value.span: 用于指定保证的跨多个版本的兼容性级别的枚举值之一。

span.span: One of the enumeration values that specifies the level of compatibility that is guaranteed across multiple versions.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 值属性对应于`guarantees`参数的构造函数。The value of the property corresponds to the `guarantees` parameter of the constructor.
